TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ErrorEventArgs extends System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ErrorEventArgs> derives from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs> class, which provides data for a cancelable event. In an event handler you can set the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true` to cancel the event. For the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionAuthenticationModule.SignOutError> event, setting this property to `true` indicates that processing of the sign-out request should stop and the exception should not be propagated to the client.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ErrorEventArgs.Exception%2A> property contains the underlying exception that resulted in the event being raised.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Exception exception) cil managed

Docs.param: The exception that occurred. Sets the property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property of the new <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ErrorEventArgs> instance is initialized to `false`; the event is not cancelled.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool cancel, class System.Exception exception) cil managed

Docs.param: The initial cancel state. Sets the property.
The exception that occurred. Sets the property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified cancel state and exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The exception that caused the event to be raised.
